columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to calculate the cash collection in each quarter using by completing the table.
**Cash Collection**, often known as payment collection, is the process by which a company recovers money from customers or other businesses to whom it has given an invoice.

## Requirement a

Assuming the company has a 45-day collection period, let's first compute the percentage of currents sales that should be collected by dividing the difference between total days in quarter and cash collection period by the total days in quarter.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{\% of Current Sales} &= \dfrac{\text{Total days in Quarter - Cash Collection Period}}{\text{Total days in Quarter }}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{90 - 45}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{45}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\text{50\% or  }{\frac{1}{2}}}}
\end{aligned}$$

Cash Collection is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Cash Collection} &= \text{Beg. Receivables} + {\text{(50\% of Current Sales)}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we can compute the cash collection using the equation in step 4.

|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| Beginning Receivables| $\text{\$ 365}$| $\text{\$ 425}$| $\text{\$ 440}$| $\text{\$ 480}$| 
|50% of Sales | $\underline{\text{425}}$ |$\underline{\text{440}}$ |$\underline{\text{480}}$ |$\underline{\text{520}}$ | 
|Cash Collection  |$\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 790}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 865}}}$|$\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 920}}}$ |$\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 1,000}}}$ |

Let's now complete the table given.  Note that to compute the ending receivable, we will deduct the cash collection from the sum of beginning receivables and sales.

| Ending Receivable| $\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 425}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 440}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 480}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\hspace{5pt}\textbf{\$ 520}}}$|

## Requirement b

Assuming the  company has a 60-day collection period, let's first compute the percentage of currents sales that should be collected.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{\% of Current Sales} &= \dfrac{\text{Total days in Quarter - Cash Collection Period}}{\text{Total days in Quarter }}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{90 - 60}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{30}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\text{33.33 \% or  }{\frac{1}{3}}}}
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we can compute the cash collection using the equation in step 4.

## Requirement c

Assuming the  company has a 30-day collection period, let's first compute the percentage of currents sales that should be collected.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{\% of Current Sales} &= \dfrac{\text{Total days in Quarter - Cash Collection Period}}{\text{Total days in Quarter }}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{90 - 30}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{60}}{\text{90}}\\[10pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\text{66.67\% or  }{\frac{2}{3}}}}
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we can compute the cash collection using the equation in step 4.
